item.title: Sean add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sean add a quote by F.E. Smith, Lord Birkenhead
Sean add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A lady came up to me one day and said 'Sir! You are drunk', to which I replied 'I am drunk today madam, and tomorrow I shall be sober but you will still be ugly." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I have claimed that Escape is one of the main functions of fairy-stories, and since I do not disapprove of them, it is plain that I do not accept the tone of scorn or pity with which 'Escape' is now so often used. Why should a man be scorned if, finding himself in prison, he tries to get out and go home? Or if he cannot do so, he thinks and talks about other topics than jailers and prison-walls?" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "You cannot pass," he said. The orcs stood still, and a dead silence fell. "I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udûn. Go back to the Shadow! You cannot pass." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sean add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sean add a quote by A.A. Milne
Sean add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "And the ship went out into the High Sea and passed into the West, until at last on a night of rain Frodo smelled a sweet fragrance on the air and heard the sound of singing that came over the water. And then it seemed to him that as in his dream in the house of Bombadil, the grey rain-curtain turned all to silver glass and was rolled back, and he beheld white shores and beyond them a far green country under a swift sunrise." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is perilous to study too deeply the arts of the Enemy, for good or for ill." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It isn't Narnia, you know," sobbed Lucy. "It's you. We shan't meet you there. And how can we live, never meeting you?" "But you shall meet me, dear one," said Aslan. "Are -are you there too, Sir?" said Edmund. "I am," said Aslan. "But there I have another name. You must learn to know me by that name. This was the very reason why you were brought to Narnia, that by knowing me here for a little, you may know me better there." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sean add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Religious liberty might be supposed to mean that everybody is free to discuss religion. In practice it means that hardly anybody is allowed to mention it." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sean add a quote by Emile Cammaerts
item.description: "When men chose not to believe in God, they do not thereafter believe in nothing. They then become capable of believing in anything." -- Emile Cammaerts

item.title: Sean add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Tradition means giving votes to the most obscure of all classes, our ancestors. It is the democracy of the dead. Tradition refuses to submit to the small and arrogant oligarchy of those who merely happen to be walking about." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For I have known them all already, known them all— Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons, I have measured out my life with coffee spoons." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Time for you and time for me, And time yet for a hundred indecisions, And for a hundred visions and revisions, Before the taking of a toast and tea." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "I have measured out my life with coffee spoons." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"I have heard the mermaids singing, each to each.
I do not think that they will sing to me." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We have lingered in the chambers of the sea By sea-girls wreathed with seaweed red and brown Till human voices wake us... and we drown." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot.
item.description: "There will be time, there will be time To prepare a face to meet the faces that you meet." -- T.S. Eliot.

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot.
Sean add a quote by Julian of Norwich
item.description: "All shall be well, and all shall be well and all manner of thing shall be well." -- Julian of Norwich

item.title: Sean add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through." -- Ira Glass

item.title: Sean add a quote by William Carey
item.description: "If he give me credit for being a plodder he will describe me justly. Anything beyond that will be too much. I can plod. I can persevere in any definite pursuit. To this I owe everything." -- William Carey
